Archaeologists decipher 3,200-year-old stone telling of invasion of mysterious sea people | The 29-metre limestone frieze, found in 1878 bears the longest known hieroglyphic inscription from the Bronze Age. Only a handful of scholars worldwide, can read its ancient Luwian language.
